__e: Has he said something to you... about the gambling debts?
Not to mention gambling debts that owes six hundred pounds, at the very least!
Dad gambled away that house and left with another woman.
Not to mention gambling debts that owes six hundred pounds, at the very least!
Dad gambled away that house and left with another woman.
He only did it because he said his family needed the money so bad.
I never carried debt, and I ain't starting now.
I'll fetch his things and settle his debts and have a service at home to say goodbye.
I don't ever like to be in debt, and the fact is... I owe you my life.
And if your accounts are not settled by the end of the month...
But you can't always pay your debts to the people you owe 'em to.
You cannot collect a debt from a dead man.
Well, with as much debt as you have, probably not next year either.
He never made a go of it though and when he died he left several debts which Mother worked hard to clear up.
No, I will not. And you don't have to keep reminding me of my debt to you.
These debts I speak of are different.
Sir Walter, I have been your neighbour for many years and am as solicitous for your family as anybody could be. But your debts are extreme.
Those are my favours, Tommy. For me.
When my wife first come here, like me, she has nothing, and she owe much to the snakehead.
I don't want to be in debt to any of my friends.
